intro: Diapensia lapponica var. asiatica, commonly known as the Asian rock sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. This variant is closely related to other Diapensia species but is distinguished by its geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences.
